flawed_nl_solution:
The discount for the Delta flight would come to $850 * 0.2 = $<<850*0.2=170>>170.
The final price of the Delta flight would come to $850 - $170 = $<<850-170=680>>680.
The discount of the United flight would come to $1100 * 0.3 = $<<1100*0.3=303>>303.
The final price of the United flight would come to $1100 - $303 = $<<1100-303=797>>797.
The Delta flight would be cheaper than the United flight by $797 - $680 = $<<797-680=117>>117.
#### 117

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 330, not 303. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
